enumeratedValue.name: USB_LPMCNTRL_EN_NONE
enumeratedValue.description: LPM and Extended transactions are not supported. In this case, the USB does not respond to LPM transactions and LPM transactions cause a timeout

enumeratedValue.name: USB_LPMCNTRL_EN_EXT
enumeratedValue.description: LPM is not supported but extended transactions are supported. In this case, the USB does respond to an LPM transaction with a STALL

enumeratedValue.name: USB_LPMCNTRL_EN_LPMEXT
enumeratedValue.description: The USB supports LPM extended transactions. In this case, the USB responds with a NYET or an ACK as determined by the value of TXLPM and other conditions

enumeratedValue.name: GPIO_DR12R_DRV12_12MA
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding GPIO pin has 12-mA drive. This encoding is only valid if the GPIOPP EDE bit is set and the appropriate GPIOPC EDM bit field is programmed to 0x3

enumeratedValue.name: GPIO_PC_EDM0_DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Drive values of 2, 4 and 8 mA are maintained. GPIO n Drive Select (GPIODRnR) registers function as normal

enumeratedValue.name: GPIO_PC_EDM0_6MA
enumeratedValue.description: An additional 6 mA option is provided

enumeratedValue.name: GPIO_PC_EDM0_PLUS2MA
enumeratedValue.description: A 2 mA driver is always enabled; setting the corresponding GPIODR4R register bit adds 2 mA and setting the corresponding GPIODR8R of GPIODR12R register bit adds an additional 4 mA

enumeratedValue.name: EEPROM_EEPROT_PROT_RWNPW
enumeratedValue.description: This setting is the default. If there is no password, the block is not protected and is readable and writable

enumeratedValue.name: EEPROM_EEPROT_PROT_RWPW
enumeratedValue.description: If there is a password, the block is readable or writable only when unlocked

enumeratedValue.name: EEPROM_EEPROT_PROT_RONPW
enumeratedValue.description: If there is no password, the block is readable, not writable

enumeratedValue.name: EPI_GPCFG_ASIZE_12BIT
enumeratedValue.description: Up to 12 bits wide. This size cannot be used with 24-bit data

enumeratedValue.name: EPI_GPCFG_ASIZE_20BIT
enumeratedValue.description: Up to 20 bits wide. This size cannot be used with data sizes other than 8

enumeratedValue.name: EPI_ADDRMAP_ERADR_HBQS

enumeratedValue.name: EPI_ADDRMAP_EPADR_HBQS
enumeratedValue.description: Only to be used with Host Bus quad chip select. In quad chip select mode, CS2n maps to 0xA000.0000 and CS3n maps to 0xC000.0000

enumeratedValue.name: EPI_FIFOLVL_RDFIFO_1
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger when there are 1 or more entries in the NBRFIFO

enumeratedValue.name: EPI_FIFOLVL_RDFIFO_2
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger when there are 2 or more entries in the NBRFIFO

enumeratedValue.name: EPI_FIFOLVL_RDFIFO_4
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger when there are 4 or more entries in the NBRFIFO

enumeratedValue.name: EPI_FIFOLVL_RDFIFO_6
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger when there are 6 or more entries in the NBRFIFO

enumeratedValue.name: EPI_FIFOLVL_RDFIFO_7
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger when there are 7 or more entries in the NBRFIFO

enumeratedValue.name: EPI_FIFOLVL_RDFIFO_8
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger when there are 8 entries in the NBRFIFO

enumeratedValue.name: EPI_FIFOLVL_WRFIFO_EMPT
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is triggered while WRFIFO is empty.

enumeratedValue.name: EPI_FIFOLVL_WRFIFO_2
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is triggered until there are only two slots available. Thus, trigger is deasserted when there are two WRFIFO entries present. This configuration is optimized for bursts of 2

enumeratedValue.name: EPI_FIFOLVL_WRFIFO_1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt is triggered until there is one WRFIFO entry available. This configuration expects only single writes

enumeratedValue.name: EPI_FIFOLVL_WRFIFO_NFULL
enumeratedValue.description: Trigger interrupt when WRFIFO is not full, meaning trigger will continue to assert until there are four entries in the WRFIFO
